page.title: 11SERVICES: Roads & Water
page.content: There are two{main roads}which run through the region, the{A30}goes west to south from Stockbridge to Salisbury and the{B3084}goes north to south through Broughton. All the other roads are unclassified. At the{pump house}at Chattis Hill there is a bore hole which is about three hundred metres deep and and the water is pumped out of the bore hole to the filter bed near Rose Cottage. The water is filtered and pumped to the{reservoir}on Broughton Downs where it is stored till we need it. Most houses have their own{septic {tanks;}sometimes these have to be emptied. A big sewage lorry comes to suck out the contents and takes them away to spread on the fields to make the crops grow.
